Participants.evidence: Patients with histologically confirmed rectal adenocarcinoma with potentially resectable or ablatable metastases in liver or lungs were eligible.

Intervention.evidence: short-course radiotherapy followed by systemic therapy with capecitabine, oxaliplatin, and bevacizumab as neoadjuvant treatment and subsequent radical surgical treatment of primary tumor and metastatic sites was evaluated.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Overall and recurrence-free survival were calculated using the Kaplan–Meier method.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Follow-up data were available for all 50 patients.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Follow-up data were available for all 50 patients.

Result_Outcome.evidence: After a median follow-up time of 8.1 years (range 6.0–9.8), 16 patients (32.0%) were still alive and 14 (28%) were disease-free.
